page.title: 09Brock's Knapp
page.content: Brocks Knapp is a detached cottage in Walderton. It is about 200 years old at least. The owners are Mr.and Mrs.Harry. Originally it belonged to Geoffrey Phipps Hornby. Then it was brought by Stansted Estate. Brocks means badger and knapp means flint that is split to show a smooth face.The house has one an a half acres surrounded by a corn field and woodland.The ground is mainly chalk then a layer of flint and earth on top.On the side of the house is a 50ft. well. They have 3 stables and a paddock with the rest as garden and for christmas trees. Also there will be a tennis court and a double garage. On the inside of the house there are three bedrooms,one kitchen and a living room. When they have finished there will be five
